Executive Assistant [Male] Job at Sylvastar Group




        
    

        
        Sylvastar Group is a diversified Nigerian conglomerate with its headquarters in Abuja, Nigeria, operating across multiple sectors including real estate, agriculture, food & beverages, finance, and petrochemical manufacturing.

The company emphasizes innovation, sustainability, and excellence, aiming to deliver high-quality services that not only meet market needs but also create lasting social and economic impact. They focus on building long-term relationships with clients, stakeholders, and communities.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Assistant [Male]
Job Location: ICS Drive, Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a highly organized, proactive, and detail-oriented Executive Assistant to provide comprehensive administrative and operational support to senior executives.
	The ideal candidate will manage schedules, coordinate communication, and ensure smooth day-to-day operations with professionalism and confidentiality.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage executive calendars, appointments, meetings, and travel arrangements.
	Serve as the primary point of contact between executives and internal/external stakeholders.
	Draft, review, and manage correspondence, reports, and presentations.
	Organize meetings, prepare agendas, take minutes, and follow up on action items.
	Handle confidential information with discretion and professionalism.
	Coordinate office operations, logistics, and executive projects.
	Track deadlines, manage priorities, and ensure timely completion of tasks.
	Assist with event planning, board meetings, and executive engagements.


Requirements & Qualifications


	Minimum of HND / B.Sc. in Business Administration, Office Management, or a related field.
	Proven experience as an Executive Assistant, Personal Assistant, or similar role.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Strong organizational, multitasking, and time-management abilities.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office, Google Workspace, and office management tools.
	Ability to work independently and under pressure.


Personal Attributes:


	Highly professional, discreet, and trustworthy.
	Proactive, solution-oriented, and adaptable.
	Strong interpersonal and relationship management skills.
	Attention to detail with a high level of accuracy.
	Strong work ethic and positive attitude.


Remuneration
Competitive salary (N100,000 - N150,000 / month) and benefits package.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to: hr@sylvastargroup.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "HR & Admin Lead",
  "description": "EmDam Strategies Limited is a distinguished business management consultancy firm empowering organizations to unlock their full potential. Our team of experts delivers data-driven solutions in business modelling, training and development, talent acquisition, and management, driving sustainable growth and business excellence.


With a passion for fostering success, we partner with clients to navigate challenges, seize opportunities, and achieve their goals.



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR &amp; Admin Lead

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time



Job Summary


	The HR &amp; Admin Lead is responsible for managing people operations and administrative systems across multiple restaurant branches.
	The role focuses on recruitment, staff welfare, compliance, attendance discipline, and reducing employee turnover by strengthening performance management and employee engagement.


Job Description (What you will do)
Core HR Functions:


	Manage end-to-end recruitment: job postings, interviews, selection, onboarding, and confirmations
	Create and enforce staff policies (attendance, discipline, dress code, conduct, etc.)
	Lead employee relations: conflict resolution, warnings, and disciplinary processes
	Develop and implement strategies to reduce staff turnover across branches
	Coordinate staff scheduling support with branch supervisors and operations
	Maintain accurate employee records, contracts, and HR documentation
	Conduct periodic staff performance evaluations with branch leadership
	Support training plans (customer service, hygiene, SOPs, safety)


Core Admin Functions:


	Oversee office/branch administrative systems and documentation
	Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and internal standards
	Handle staff welfare activities (ID cards, uniforms, basic needs coordination)

title: Social Media Manager Job at the Vault Recruitment (TVR)
content:
The Vault Recruitment (TVR) is a fast growing recruitment firm specializing in connecting top talent with SME's and Startup organizations. Our team of experienced recruiters understands the unique needs and challenges of the modern job market and uses our extensive network and industry knowledge to find the best candidates for our clients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager
Job Location: Arepo, Ogun
Work Structure: Hybrid (2 days in-office weekly)
Vacancy Code: SEED001

Role Overview
     

            
    




	We are seeking a creative and proactive Social Media Manager to manage our online presence, create engaging content, and grow brand visibility across digital platforms.
	The ideal candidate should be hands-on with design and basic video editing and be available to work onsite a few days each week.


Key Responsibilities


	Plan, create, and manage content across social media platforms (Instagram, Facebook, TikTok, X, LinkedIn).
	Design visually appealing graphics for posts, stories, and campaigns.
	Edit short-form videos and reels for social media engagement.
	Schedule posts, monitor performance, and generate basic analytics reports.
	Engage with followers, respond to comments and messages, and build an active online community.
	Stay up to date with social media trends and recommend content ideas.
	Collaborate with internal teams to align content with brand goals.


Requirements


	Proven experience as a Social Media Manager or similar role.
	Graphic design skills (Canva, Photoshop, or similar tools).
	Strong video editing skills (CapCut, InShot, Premiere Pro, or similar).
	Strong understanding of social media platforms and content trends.
	Good communication and content-writing skills.
	Ability to work 2 days onsite weekly (hybrid).
	Must reside in or around Arepo, Ogun State.


Salary
N100,000 / month    

    

        Click here to Apply
